Although I must say this game is a bit more then your average survive and build game. The graphics are high end, the scenery is gorgeous. The attacking is complex and you can attack from every direction, and block. There is an extensive skill leveling with battle and life. negative.review:
seriously, stay away and safe yourself the money, this piece of shit is so littered with bugs and unfinished mechanics one might think it's an absurdly early "early access" title, while in reality it's a "fully released" game with DLC, a cash shop (with actual ingame benefits) and skins slapped on...
not to forget that the developer doesn't give a flying horse sh!t about fixing anything or even trying to give any kind of support, they won't even react to direct pings on their discord server (probably since none of the actual staff are still checking in at all)
here's a small list of a few of the issues (there's far more):

combat
 
- choppy as hell when trying to parry anything and the shield blocking is not working most of the times since enemies strike right through it with most attacks even at maximum shield skill and you hearing the blocking being successful
-ambushers often getting spawned inside mountains or walls making them unable to reach you while also keeping you in permanent combat mode,

building
- is a major pain in the bum thanks to ridiculous snapping that quite a lot of times doesn't want to snap the way you want (sloped roof tiles being a prime offender)
- the boundary marker keeps flashing red as if you didn't set protection times (EVEN ON PVE) while in the menu it actually let's you set 0 hours and save it, doesn't change a thing about the flashing,

farming 
- big fields are so bugged it's literally a search the working pixel where you can actually till the field
- smashing plants to gain back some fertility often results in plants you're not even hitting to simply vanish into thin air and giving nothing in return making sustainable fields quite absurd until you learned the best fertilizers/compost

companion/mount AI
- utter garbage that can't even follow you in a straight line and constantly get's stuck on the smallest obstacles or falls down cliffs because it tried to walk a huge circle around a small pebble
- while taming the horses run in a stupid straight line until they either reach the end of the map, get stuck on an obstacle or would die from falling down a cliff

arts
- most arts make it sound like they'd affect you, while in reality only affecting the outright useless NPC warriors,
quite a few art rolls just vanish upon usage instead of giving any art xp as they're supposed to

Myth of Empires offers a huge amount of content, maybe even too much ‚Äì but it‚Äôs presented in such a chaotic and poorly explained way that you constantly need to look up guides or videos just to understand the basics.

‚úî Pros:
‚Ä¢ Extremely rich world with lots of potential.
‚Ä¢ Strong focus on crafting, building, and co-op gameplay.

‚úò Cons:
‚ùó Confusing Crafting & Structures
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Multiple workbenches for armor, weapons, different cages, and various building types ‚Äì no clear explanation of what each is for.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ The game provides no proper tutorials or in-game guidance, forcing you to use external guides.
‚ùó Terrible Translation (English & German)
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Many texts are poorly translated, making them misleading or completely wrong.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Crafting/building requirements are sometimes incorrect or unclear, leading to frustration.

‚ùó Dedicated Server Issue
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Simply couldnt join servers of the host even with port forwading and all the usual settings done.

‚ùó LAN / Self-Hosted Server Issues ‚Äì Major Problem
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ We wanted to play casually on a self-hosted LAN server, but it‚Äôs been a nightmare.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ The server constantly loses its settings, even when run as admin.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Some settings (e.g., increased horse movement speed) don‚Äôt sync properly to all clients.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Every session starts with fixing server issues instead of actually playing.

‚ùó DLCs Released While Core Issues Remain
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Despite all these problems, paid DLCs are being released, while essential bug fixes and quality-of-life improvements are still missing.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ This feels like the wrong priority and is very frustrating for players.

Conclusion:
This game could be an amazing sandbox experience, but right now it feels unfinished and frustrating.
The bad translations, confusing systems, and broken self-hosted servers make casual co-op play almost impossible.

‚ùå Not recommended ‚Äì at least until core issues are fixed and stability is improved.

With the limited time you have on this planet, and the tremendous amount of other stuff to do and games to play, Myth of Empires doesn't deserve anyone's time.

There is just way too many limitations for a game that is playable in single player. They hard coded numerous game mechanics so you cant adjust their settings. Things like Mining Hut build limit or a setting to make torches not require fuel. It really only shows a deep seeded disrespect for the people who play this game, not too mention the obvious pay to win stuff for official servers with the Gold currency and the way you can spend gold on enhancing skills.

Overall this game is just a crappy Conan Exiles knock off. If it wasnt on sale for $10 I never would have bought it, even though I still feel cheated. With the limitations on customizing server settings, you either need a lot of other people to play with to get a good amount of the content or you suffer through a ridiculous grind for even the basic of gear, with most recipes requiring a crazy amount of materials. 

Base building is another major turn off. Im not sure how they accomplished it but they somehow made building worse than ARK. All the building in this game made me do was think about how ARK building was actually pretty good in comparison and made me want to take back all the stuff I said about it. It even made me think the logging simulator game Sons of the Forest had decent building. 

With all of the bad stuff, the game has OK directional combat, even though blocking is pointless when you can just move out of your attackers swing. The map is huge and is not bad in its design, although some land formations dont really make sense in a real world view. There is a lot of content, you will get lost in the menus and will struggle to figure out whats what. The level cap is crazy, which is nice cause it spreads out the content a bit.

One more thing, dont bother buying the DLC's unless you plan to actually play this. You wont be able to use anything from them until level 45-50, which takes a long time. It honestly makes the devs look really scummy not mentioning that in the DLC description, but scum will be scum I guess.

If you cant get this game for $10 or less just stay away. The devs obviously made this game to intentionally be some sort scam one way or another. With the lack of good video content online and the terrible wiki info, its clear most people realized what this game really was. Just another turd spray painted gold. Do yourself a favor and just buy Conan Exiles, trust me, you wont regret it.

Myth of Empires offers a huge amount of content, maybe even too much ‚Äì but it‚Äôs presented in such a chaotic and poorly explained way that you constantly need to look up guides or videos just to understand the basics.

‚úî Pros:
‚Ä¢ Extremely rich world with lots of potential.
‚Ä¢ Strong focus on crafting, building, and co-op gameplay.

‚úò Cons:
‚ùó Confusing Crafting & Structures
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Multiple workbenches for armor, weapons, different cages, and various building types ‚Äì no clear explanation of what each is for.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ The game provides no proper tutorials or in-game guidance, forcing you to use external guides.
‚ùó Terrible Translation (English & German)
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Many texts are poorly translated, making them misleading or completely wrong.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Crafting/building requirements are sometimes incorrect or unclear, leading to frustration.

‚ùó Dedicated Server Issue
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Simply couldnt join servers of the host even with port forwading and all the usual settings done.

‚ùó LAN / Self-Hosted Server Issues ‚Äì Major Problem
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ We wanted to play casually on a self-hosted LAN server, but it‚Äôs been a nightmare.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ The server constantly loses its settings, even when run as admin.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Some settings (e.g., increased horse movement speed) don‚Äôt sync properly to all clients.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Every session starts with fixing server issues instead of actually playing.

‚ùó DLCs Released While Core Issues Remain
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ Despite all these problems, paid DLCs are being released, while essential bug fixes and quality-of-life improvements are still missing.
‚ÄÉ‚Ä¢ This feels like the wrong priority and is very frustrating for players.

Conclusion:
This game could be an amazing sandbox experience, but right now it feels unfinished and frustrating.
The bad translations, confusing systems, and broken self-hosted servers make casual co-op play almost impossible.

‚ùå Not recommended ‚Äì at least until core issues are fixed and stability is improved.

seriously, stay away and safe yourself the money, this piece of shit is so littered with bugs and unfinished mechanics one might think it's an absurdly early "early access" title, while in reality it's a "fully released" game with DLC, a cash shop (with actual ingame benefits) and skins slapped on...
not to forget that the developer doesn't give a flying horse sh!t about fixing anything or even trying to give any kind of support, they won't even react to direct pings on their discord server (probably since none of the actual staff are still checking in at all)
here's a small list of a few of the issues (there's far more):

combat
 
- choppy as hell when trying to parry anything and the shield blocking is not working most of the times since enemies strike right through it with most attacks even at maximum shield skill and you hearing the blocking being successful
-ambushers often getting spawned inside mountains or walls making them unable to reach you while also keeping you in permanent combat mode,

building
- is a major pain in the bum thanks to ridiculous snapping that quite a lot of times doesn't want to snap the way you want (sloped roof tiles being a prime offender)
- the boundary marker keeps flashing red as if you didn't set protection times (EVEN ON PVE) while in the menu it actually let's you set 0 hours and save it, doesn't change a thing about the flashing,

farming 
- big fields are so bugged it's literally a search the working pixel where you can actually till the field
- smashing plants to gain back some fertility often results in plants you're not even hitting to simply vanish into thin air and giving nothing in return making sustainable fields quite absurd until you learned the best fertilizers/compost

companion/mount AI
- utter garbage that can't even follow you in a straight line and constantly get's stuck on the smallest obstacles or falls down cliffs because it tried to walk a huge circle around a small pebble
- while taming the horses run in a stupid straight line until they either reach the end of the map, get stuck on an obstacle or would die from falling down a cliff

arts
- most arts make it sound like they'd affect you, while in reality only affecting the outright useless NPC warriors,
quite a few art rolls just vanish upon usage instead of giving any art xp as they're supposed to

This game is terrible.  Got it on sale for 12 bucks and I don't think I'll get any enjoyment from it.

With the limited time you have on this planet, and the tremendous amount of other stuff to do and games to play, Myth of Empires doesn't deserve anyone's time.

There is just way too many limitations for a game that is playable in single player. They hard coded numerous game mechanics so you cant adjust their settings. Things like Mining Hut build limit or a setting to make torches not require fuel. It really only shows a deep seeded disrespect for the people who play this game, not too mention the obvious pay to win stuff for official servers with the Gold currency and the way you can spend gold on enhancing skills.

Overall this game is just a crappy Conan Exiles knock off. If it wasnt on sale for $10 I never would have bought it, even though I still feel cheated. With the limitations on customizing server settings, you either need a lot of other people to play with to get a good amount of the content or you suffer through a ridiculous grind for even the basic of gear, with most recipes requiring a crazy amount of materials. 

Base building is another major turn off. Im not sure how they accomplished it but they somehow made building worse than ARK. All the building in this game made me do was think about how ARK building was actually pretty good in comparison and made me want to take back all the stuff I said about it. It even made me think the logging simulator game Sons of the Forest had decent building. 

With all of the bad stuff, the game has OK directional combat, even though blocking is pointless when you can just move out of your attackers swing. The map is huge and is not bad in its design, although some land formations dont really make sense in a real world view. There is a lot of content, you will get lost in the menus and will struggle to figure out whats what. The level cap is crazy, which is nice cause it spreads out the content a bit.

One more thing, dont bother buying the DLC's unless you plan to actually play this. You wont be able to use anything from them until level 45-50, which takes a long time. It honestly makes the devs look really scummy not mentioning that in the DLC description, but scum will be scum I guess.

If you cant get this game for $10 or less just stay away. The devs obviously made this game to intentionally be some sort scam one way or another. With the lack of good video content online and the terrible wiki info, its clear most people realized what this game really was. Just another turd spray painted gold. Do yourself a favor and just buy Conan Exiles, trust me, you wont regret it.

With the limited time you have on this planet, and the tremendous amount of other stuff to do and games to play, Myth of Empires doesn't deserve anyone's time.

There is just way too many limitations for a game that is playable in single player. They hard coded numerous game mechanics so you cant adjust their settings. Things like Mining Hut build limit or a setting to make torches not require fuel. It really only shows a deep seeded disrespect for the people who play this game, not too mention the obvious pay to win stuff for official servers with the Gold currency and the way you can spend gold on enhancing skills.

Overall this game is just a crappy Conan Exiles knock off. If it wasnt on sale for $10 I never would have bought it, even though I still feel cheated. With the limitations on customizing server settings, you either need a lot of other people to play with to get a good amount of the content or you suffer through a ridiculous grind for even the basic of gear, with most recipes requiring a crazy amount of materials. 

Base building is another major turn off. Im not sure how they accomplished it but they somehow made building worse than ARK. All the building in this game made me do was think about how ARK building was actually pretty good in comparison and made me want to take back all the stuff I said about it. It even made me think the logging simulator game Sons of the Forest had decent building. 

With all of the bad stuff, the game has OK directional combat, even though blocking is pointless when you can just move out of your attackers swing. The map is huge and is not bad in its design, although some land formations dont really make sense in a real world view. There is a lot of content, you will get lost in the menus and will struggle to figure out whats what. The level cap is crazy, which is nice cause it spreads out the content a bit.

One more thing, dont bother buying the DLC's unless you plan to actually play this. You wont be able to use anything from them until level 45-50, which takes a long time. It honestly makes the devs look really scummy not mentioning that in the DLC description, but scum will be scum I guess.

If you cant get this game for $10 or less just stay away. The devs obviously made this game to intentionally be some sort scam one way or another. With the lack of good video content online and the terrible wiki info, its clear most people realized what this game really was. Just another turd spray painted gold. Do yourself a favor and just buy Conan Exiles, trust me, you wont regret it.
